name: Financial Class
description: The FC data type is used to represent financial classification information for healthcare services and patient encounters. It combines financial class codes with effective date ranges to track how patients should be billed and what payment arrangements apply during specific time periods. FC enables healthcare organizations to manage complex billing scenarios, insurance changes, and financial class transitions while maintaining accurate financial records and compliance with billing regulations.

FC.1.name: Financial Class
FC.1.description: The financial classification code indicating how the patient should be billed (e.g., Medicare, Commercial Insurance, Self-Pay, Charity Care). Determines billing procedures and payment expectations.

FC.2.name: Effective Date
FC.2.description: The date and time when this financial class becomes effective for the patient encounter. Marks the beginning of the financial classification period.

constraints.financialClass: Financial class must reference valid codes from table 0064
constraints.dateValidation: Effective date should be valid timestamp format
constraints.businessRules: Financial class changes should follow organizational billing policies
